intro: Draba stenobotrys, commonly known as the narrow-leafed whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in alpine and arctic regions, often in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant has basal leaves that are narrow and linear, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in a raceme. It produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Draba stenobotrys is adapted to cold climates and is often found in high-altitude environments.
